column4: i have dapper.  If I have the feisty disk, when I install, can I just put it in ext3 over Dapper?
you could, but it's best to (have a backup and) tell the installer to format the dapper root partition.
how do i format the dapper root partition?
it's a tick box in the feisty installer.
choose manual partitioning
so all I have to do is backup, do a format of the dapper root partition, and then install feisty?
and what is the "dapper root partition"?  ext3?
even easier. You let the installer do it all for you.
by dapper root partition I mean the partition where the system files of your old installation went. Yes, it's very probably ext3-formatted.
i don't feel very comfortable by letting it doing it all automatically if that's what you mean
the installer (ubiquity by name) is so well tested that you're more likely to screw up than it (at least if you're like me ;)
but won't I have to tell it somehow that I want ext3 formatted?
no. If you want anything other than ext3, you have to use the Alternate CD.

I do want ext3 but you said before that there is a tick box in manual mode to tell it to format ext3.  If I select automatic mode, how will it know to format it?  and how will it know that I don't want to create a second ext3 partition?
there is a tick box to format it. You don't get a choice as to the file system.
you've got a backup, right? Stop worrying and get to work (is my suggestion)
thanks, i'll work on it.  I just don't want to screw up my hard drive with more partitions than I want.
there is very little danger of that.
ok, thanks again.  see ya
just go through the install process. Choose manual partitioning. ubiquity will find your swap partition and offer you ways of using it.
okay, ty.
